蠞字的基本解释

蠞
jié
古书上说的一种海蟹。

蠞字的汉语字典释义

[①]［jié］
［《廣韻》昨結切，入屑，從。］
节肢动物，形似蟹。体长一寸左右，呈细杆状，胸部有脚七对，腹部退化，生活在海洋藻类或苔藓虫上。也称竹节虫或麦秆虫。

蠞字的康熙字典解释

【申集中】【虫字部】　蠞； 康熙笔画：21； 页码：页1101第30
【唐韻】【集韻】?昨結切，音截。蟲名，似蟹，生海中。　又【玉篇】子結切，音節。義同。

蠞字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
蠞字的起名意思

暂无。

Crenellation
Basic explanation of words
Crenellation
jié
A kind of sea crab said in ancient books.
Crenellation
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［jié］
["Guangyun" was cut yesterday, into the crumbs, from. ]
Arthropod, shaped like a crab. It is about an inch long and has a thin rod shape. It has seven pairs of feet on its chest. Its abdomen is degenerated. It lives on marine algae or bryozoans. Also called stick insects or straw insects.
Crenellation
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Shen Collection] [Insect Character Department] 　蠞; Kangxi Strokes: 21; Page Number: Page 1101 Page 30
[Tang Yun] [Ji Yun]? Yesterday's knot cut, sound cut. The name of the insect, like a crab, is in the sea.　[Jade Chapter] Sub-knot cut, syllable. The same meaning.
